Package model

Class EstuaryModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Model
      • model.EstuaryModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameStateModel

    public class EstuaryModel
extends Model
implements GameStateModel
    This model has to keep track of all the fish swimming under water, update their positions, and check if the user has selected the correct fish
    Author:
    Miguel Fuentes, W Mathieu Mimms-Boyce, Devon Pirestani, Andre Green, Dylan Martin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EstuaryModel​(int frameWidth, int frameHeight, CodeListener listener, boolean tutorialMode)
      This constructor calls the superclass constructor and sets various booleans about popups to false and sets whether tutorialMode is true or false.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean allResearched​()
      Checks if all animals have been researched
      void chooseTarget​()
      This checks if all of the animals have been researched with allResearched() and if not randomly selects one of the remaining animals as the target of your research
      void debugChooseTarget​()
      This allows the tester to skip clicking the animal for debugging purposes
      void debugResearchAll​()
      This will automatically research every fish, this is used in debugging mode
      Model nextModel​()
      This is used to transition from model to model
      void registerClick​(int clickX, int clickY)
      This checks the position of the mouseclick, to see if an Animal was clicked on, and if so if the selected animal is passes to animalCaught(gameobject.Animal).
      void setPopupHappened​(boolean b)
      This sets popupHappened
      QuizModel timeUp​()
      This transitions the Quiz and passes the ArrayList of Animals which have been researched to the QuizModel
      void update​()
      This will pause game and display popups if they have not yet been displayed, it will also call for all of the Animals to have their positions updated

        addGameObject, getFrameHeight, getFrameWidth, getGameObjects, getListener, getTime, isTimerRunning, setFrameHeight, setFrameWidth, setListener, setTime, setTimerRunning, tutorialModel

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
